title: Sallie Mae
Meta_Description: Sallie Mae is a company based in the United States that originates, services, and collects student loans. Government guaranteed student loans, private student loans, K-12 loans, money market accounts, high yield savings accounts, insurance services, and college saving schemes are all part of the company's service portfolio.

content: Sallie Mae is a well-known student loan company that provides private loans to students and graduates in a number of degree programmes. Sallie Mae is a publicly listed firm in the United States that is a leading provider of private student loans. Sallie Mae has $20.5 billion in private student loans as of the third quarter of 2021. Another $703 million was held in federal student loans under the presently Federal Family Education Loan (FFEL) Program. It was a private, for-profit organisation that was subject to government laws.
Borrowers must be of legal age in their state (often 18 years old). Younger candidates will require a cosigner who is both qualified and creditworthy.
Sallie Mae does not publish a list of qualified schools, but you can search for a school's name at the start of the loan application to discover whether your institution qualifies.
Sallie Mae does not specify a minimum credit score. At the time of loan origination, Sallie Mae student loans should have a FICO Score of 670 or higher.

content: A Certificate of Deposit requires a $2,500 minimum deposit and a $2,500 minimum balance to open.
There is no minimum deposit required to open a non-CD Account.
A minimum deposit is not required to start a High-Yield Savings Account.
They retain the right to terminate an account if it is dormant, with a balance of $100 or less and no activity for the last 12 months.
At an accredited school or institution, you may be able to receive 100% of your school-certified expenditures paid.
Sallie Mae assists students at all stages of their educational experience, including free study assistance and college price calculators to present and prospective borrowers.

Sallie Mae provides loans to students who are enrolling in less than half-time programmes, online or summer classes, students studying abroad, and students pursuing professional certification courses.
